title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
florinciu left at 00:21 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
sabageru joined #xwiki at 00:43  
sabageru left at 00:58 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
daemoen joined #xwiki at 02:54  
daemoen - (02:55): hey guys, any xwiki alternative to jira yet?  
cjdelisle` - (02:57): No. There is a plugin for interacting with jira but we use jira for our tracker.  
daemoen - (02:58): cjdelisle`, yeah,  i remember someone was talking about writing a new module for xwiki that would allow a bug tracking system  
daemoen - (02:59): ive found that xwiki is awesome compared 1:1 with confluence  
daemoen - (02:59): would absolutely love to see the project release an alternative to jira  
cjdelisle` - (02:59): It would be awesome and I think it could be done at the application level. That means you, solder! ;)  
daemoen - (03:00): lol, im not a devel, im a systems admin ;)  
cjdelisle` - (03:00): s/solder/soldier I'm a dev, not a electronics repair man :/  
daemoen - (03:01): lol  
daemoen - (03:17): does xwiki support integration of bugzilla or mantis?  
jbrBridge - (03:17): Not that I know of.  
cjdelisle` - (03:18): lol. Wrong window.  
cjdelisle` - (03:18): I run the bridge so I can (accidently) middleman what it says.  
venkatna joined #xwiki at 04:10  
venkatna left at 04:11 (Client Quit  
venkatna joined #xwiki at 04:13  
venkatna left at 04:36 (Remote host closed the connection  
venkatna joined #xwiki at 04:38  
venkatna left at 04:38 (Client Quit  
venkatna joined #xwiki at 05:11  
abusenius left at 06:00 (Quit: Konversation terminated!  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 07:54  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 07:55  
vmassol - (08:03): !who  
jbrBridge - (08:03): \* members: CalebJamesDeLisle  
Denis joined #xwiki at 08:46  
jstoldt joined #xwiki at 08:55  
jstoldt - (08:57): morning!  
evalica joined #xwiki at 09:02  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 09:15  
arkub joined #xwiki at 09:18  
rstavro joined #xwiki at 09:19  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 09:20  
vmassol left at 09:26 (Quit: Leaving.  
sburjan - (09:27): hello. I see no new snapshot of 2.6 since friday  
cjdelisle` - (09:28): Good morning, that's because there weren't any changes so no new builds were triggered.  
sabageru joined #xwiki at 09:29  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 09:30  
vmassol - (09:32): some tweet that sergiu will like: http://bit.ly/blg9cS  
vmassol - (09:32): (it's about using GitModel as the model for a CMS/Blog)  
vmassol - (09:33): I wonder if the JCR API can support the Git model  
cjdelisle` - (09:35): http://eclipse.org/jgit/  
sburjan - (09:36): vmassol: did we manage to fix the blocker we found on friday ?  
cjdelisle` - (09:36): It'd work well for keeping a history but the current version will be very slow unless it runs in a database.  
sburjan - (09:36): (good morning)  
vmassol - (09:36): sburjan: hi. Which blocker?  
sburjan - (09:36): the one jvelociter reported .. regarding cron  
vmassol - (09:37): cjdelisle`: yep I know about jgit  
vmassol - (09:37): sburjan: yes I fixed it 30 mn after it was reported ;)  
vmassol - (09:37): (and re-released)  
sburjan - (09:38): okay  
sburjan - (09:38): so when are we going to release ?  
vmassol - (09:38): sburjan: any more issue?  
lucaa left at 09:38 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
sburjan - (09:38): well .. I reported some minor issues on IE browsers, nothing major  
cjdelisle` - (09:38): IMO git is like java (and xml). It serves a purpose but has a bunch of followers who thing is can solve all of the world's problems.  
vmassol - (09:39): cjdelisle`: sure, it's the new kid on the block and thus people are excited  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 09:39  
vmassol - (09:40): we're in the peak of inflated expectations ;)  
vmassol - (09:40): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hype\_cycle  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 09:40  
cjdelisle` - (09:40): haha never saw that before.  
vmassol - (09:41): fyi gartner says wikis are at the beginning of the slope of enlightment  
vmassol - (09:42): (actually just a little bit on it)  
vmassol - (09:42): figure for 2010: http://www.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/XWiki+Hype+Cycle+Open+Source+2010  
vmassol - (09:43): hmm I don't see wikis on this pciture strange  
cjdelisle` - (09:43): http://labs.adobe.com/technologies/cirrus/ <-- there's something to keep an eye on.  
vmassol - (09:44): actually they're much further than I thought on this image: http://www.darulfaaizin.com/wanharris/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/The-hype-cycle-for-social-software-2010.png  
vmassol - (09:44): almost middle of slop of enlightment  
vmassol - (09:44): ;)  
cjdelisle` - (09:45): I think the big question is when do we (or any other webapp) start requiring things like javascript or flash.  
lucaa - (09:45): mornin' guys  
lucaa - (09:45): I would like to commit XE-756 and its XE-722 in 2.7, wdyt?  
lucaa - (09:45): I have the patches locally  
lucaa - (09:45): with some changes, more or less breaking  
lucaa - (09:46): (if the pages in XE can be considered "api")  
vmassol - (09:46): XE-722  
vmassol - (09:46): lucaa: ok for me in 2.7  
lucaa - (09:46): it's just the completion of what was started in 2.5 and 2.6  
lucaa - (09:46): there are some changes though, at least for XE-722  
lucaa - (09:47): the idea is that the main dashboard and the space dashboards will be different  
lucaa - (09:47): now there is one big big document, which gets included in both and figures out how to behave  
lucaa - (09:47): but that's a bit harder to achieve as a dashboard  
lucaa - (09:47): (voir technically impossible)  
lucaa - (09:48): so I would make them different, so that we also drop the idea of an included document in the future  
lucaa - (09:48): since dashboard should be so easy to build  
lucaa - (09:48): s/dashboard/dashboards/  
lucaa - (09:49): vmassol: brb, going up in the office  
lucaa left at 09:54 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 09:54  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 09:56  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 10:13  
vmassol - (10:15): ok finishing the release of XE/XEM 2.6  
vmassol - (10:15): we need a release manager for 2.7  
cjdelisle` - (10:16): WDYT of disabling the hudson "X is still failing" and "X is back to normal" mail? I there anything it's giving us that the daily reports are not?  
vmassol - (10:17): everyone: anything you want to add to http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise26 ?  
fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 10:21  
sburjan - (10:26): vmassol: shouldn't we have a list of JIRA issues fixed ?  
sburjan - (10:26): it is a stabilization release after all  
vmassol - (10:27): sburjan: ideally we would always list all the jira issues in addition to the noteworthy section but this needs to be automated before it happens.  
vmassol - (10:27): it's a release like any other  
vmassol - (10:28): if there were no improvements and no new features, I'd agree with you but this is i not the case  
sburjan - (10:28): okay. I'm saying this because I seen previous release notes that listed the JIRA issues fixed  
sburjan - (10:28): but you know better :)  
vmassol - (10:28): we have to think about end users  
vmassol - (10:28): what's best for them  
vmassol - (10:29): IMO what's best is a noteworthy section  
vmassol - (10:29): so that they don't have to try understand every single jira issue  
vmassol - (10:29): and we point out the important ones  
vmassol - (10:29): now  
vmassol - (10:29): as I said a link to all jira issues fixed would be nice but it's complex to make right now  
vmassol - (10:30): if you want to work on this you're more than welcome though  
vmassol - (10:30): (I've been wanting to do it for about 4 years now)  
sburjan - (10:31): hm... maybe this could be achieved with a custom JIRA filter ?  
sburjan - (10:32): all resolved bugs that had affected version 2.6 ?  
vmassol - (10:32): sburjan: you haven't solved the issue of finding the versions  
vmassol - (10:32): each project has different versions  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:32  
sburjan - (10:32): maybe a filter with a time span ?  
vmassol - (10:32): sburjan: did you test the XEM 2.6 release?  
sburjan - (10:32): all solved bugs since we started working on 2.6  
sburjan - (10:32): vmassol: yes  
vmassol - (10:32): ok cool  
sburjan - (10:39): vmassol: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download?xpage=print . Download to this points to 2.5.1 .. instead of 2.6 .. am I missing something ?  
vmassol - (10:39): mflorea and others: do we need a branch for 2.7 now so that devs can start committing stuff for 3.0? I'm a bit hesitating since it'll mean devs will be tempted to work on 3.0 stuff rather than helping out with stabilization  
vmassol - (10:40): (it also means some branch merging)  
vmassol - (10:40): I'm open though  
vmassol - (10:40): wdyt?  
cjdelisle` - (10:40): When's 3.0 to be released?  
vmassol - (10:40): in about 2.5 months  
vmassol - (10:40): for the final  
vmassol - (10:41): for M1 it's in 3-4 weeks  
vmassol - (10:41): I need to check if I sent a date proposal  
mflorea - (10:41): vmassol: I don't need it now because I'm busy with other things. I have a macro display refactoring done locally but it can wait because I'm not working on it right now  
vmassol - (10:41): (probabmy not)  
mflorea - (10:42): (macro display in WYSIWYG edit mode)  
vmassol - (10:42): I'll try to send the 3.0 proposal for review this week  
cjdelisle` - (10:42): IMO we need a branch ASAP if we have any hope to remove old apis for 3.0.  
vmassol - (10:42): cjdelisle`: 3.X  
vmassol - (10:42): not 3.0  
vmassol - (10:42): and 'm not sure we want to remove old apis for 3.x  
vmassol - (10:43): we would need to select on a case by case basis  
vmassol - (10:43): there's definitely no need to remove all old apis for 3.0, nor for 3.x final  
cjdelisle` - (10:44): Ok. I'll keep my nose out of the steering committee.  
vmassol - (10:44): we (committers) are teh steering committe  
vmassol - (10:44): committee  
vmassol - (10:44): why would you want to keep your nose out?  
cjdelisle` - (10:44): Because I disagree with just about everything ;)  
jstoldt - (10:44): vmassol:  
jstoldt - (10:45): i am going to test 2.6 final  
vmassol - (10:45): you can say so cjdelisle`  
vmassol - (10:45): it's an open discussion  
jstoldt - (10:45): and then tell you what my findings are regarding the missing icon on user watchlist  
vmassol - (10:45): jstoldt: ok cool  
jstoldt - (10:45): :)  
jstoldt - (10:46): any estimate on how much longer you'll need?  
vmassol - (10:46): cjdelisle`: I'm curious to understand why you don't feel part of the "steering committee"  
vmassol - (10:46): (there's no such thing btw, it's only about votes and proposals)  
cjdelisle` - (10:46): When I think I have information which will help make a decision and I don't think others have it, I want to share it.  
vmassol - (10:47): of course, and that's good  
vmassol - (10:47): what makes you feel you're not heard?  
cjdelisle` - (10:47): When I feel that my position has been looked at and decided against, I don't want to argue for the sake of arguing, that's just politics.  
vmassol - (10:48): re removing deprecated apis, we need a new round of brainstomring  
vmassol - (10:48): do you feel it's good to break all users for example?  
cjdelisle` - (10:49): Well, I think that's what a major release is for.  
vmassol - (10:49): so no path to upgrade?  
cjdelisle` - (10:50): Well not to break everything, just the stuff which is deprecated and maybe the query plugin stuff.  
vmassol - (10:50): ok then we're in agreement  
vmassol - (10:50): we hand pick really old stuff  
vmassol - (10:50): and decide to remove them  
vmassol - (10:50): it's on a case by case basis  
vmassol - (10:50): feel free to propose stuff to be removed on the list  
vmassol - (10:50): query plugin is a +1 from me  
vmassol - (10:51): (the one in xwiki-core)  
vmassol - (10:51): could be moved to contrib/retired probably, just to be on safe side  
vmassol - (10:51): (or not)  
cjdelisle` - (10:51): OTOH I wouldn't have proposed a major version release but I think that my points have been looked over and decided against from an informed position.  
cjdelisle` - (10:53): re pulling out query plugin, that'll be a pain, it's got a bunch of dependencies everywhere and it'll break a couple apis in the xwiki.api package.  
vmassol - (10:53): cjdelisle`: yes, I don't want to resart that debate. It was discussed and voted on….  
vmassol - (10:53): (thanks for not blocking it if you didn't agree then ;))  
vmassol - (10:54): (hope you can live with it)  
vmassol - (10:54): (anyway it's not final, anyone can propose a change at any time if there are arguments that can convince the others ;))  
cjdelisle` - (10:54): I'm not trying to debate, I'm trying to explain why I don't debate on a lot of points.  
vmassol - (10:54): yes you're wise  
vmassol - (10:54): (I wish I could be that wise :))  
vmassol - (10:55): cjdelisle`: all I want to be sure is that you don't feel isolated  
cjdelisle` - (10:55): I know you have looked at my point of view, and I have no new information to bring so "I keep my nose out of the steering committee"  
vmassol - (10:55): ie you don't feel that what you say isn't listened to by others  
vmassol - (10:56): cjdelisle`: sometimes, I also think that keeping backward compat, and not thinking out of the box slows the xwiki project down  
vmassol - (10:56): but then reality kicks back in…. unfortunately  
vmassol - (10:57): at some point in the past we hesitated between revolution and evolution  
cjdelisle` - (10:57): It's a balance for any project.  
vmassol - (10:57): ie create a branch and start from scratch in that branch  
vmassol - (10:57): yes it is  
cjdelisle` - (10:58): On the topic of wild and wacky, maybe the thing to do is do a clean slate branch for serving a completely different purpose.  
vmassol - (10:58): sure  
vmassol - (10:58): there are lots of ideas  
vmassol - (10:58): like WITS  
cjdelisle` - (10:59): AKA XWiki is a fully functional enterprise wiki. Branch to make a small fast secure wiki. Something like that.  
vmassol - (10:59): yes, the problem is manpower  
vmassol - (10:59): how to maintain several projects at once  
vmassol - (10:59): I mean anyone can do what you propose  
vmassol - (10:59): by starting something in contrib for ex  
cjdelisle` - (11:00): haha I already have my own "small" project eating up my weekends ;)  
vmassol - (11:00): it's more different if we want it to be an community strategy  
vmassol - (11:00): s/different/difficult/  
vmassol - (11:00): hehe  
vmassol - (11:00): the strategy I'm personally following  
vmassol - (11:00): is componentization  
vmassol - (11:01): so that in order to make a small and fast wiki  
vmassol - (11:01): you'd not install some modules  
vmassol - (11:01): this is an effort in progress that'll take a few more years ....  
vmassol - (11:01): (before we have focused modules)  
vmassol - (11:01): (for the whole platform)  
cjdelisle` - (11:02): Interesting.  
vmassol - (11:02): model, action, template, skin, displayers, etc  
vmassol - (11:02): then it reduces the cost of building something custom  
cjdelisle` - (11:02): model will be the slippery slope toward becoming the next rat's nest.  
sburjan - (11:04): we still have plugins in 2 places, and moving towards components  
sburjan - (11:04): we have to be consistent IMO  
cjdelisle` - (11:04): I think we need to have a single base element which can be stored in the database and can be converted to XML. That element will be the basis for the Document and the Object.  
cjdelisle` - (11:05): I like the c.x.x.objects package. It was visionary although it has it's limitations.  
cjdelisle` - (11:06): I know there is way too much code for putting different things into the database and converting different things to XML.  
mflorea left at 11:08 (Quit: Leaving.  
jstoldt - (11:08): woohoo, time for upgrading! :-D  
cjdelisle` - (11:09): If that's not sarcasm then it is a great complement.  
daemoen left at 11:10 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds  
jstoldt - (11:11): no sarcasm intended  
jstoldt - (11:12): i was actually waiting for this since friday... unfortunately you did not make the release on friday, so that kinda screwed up my plans for friday ;)  
cjdelisle` - (11:12): If you're not dreading upgrade time then we must be doing something right.  
jstoldt - (11:13): well, the way i set it up now i need approximately 20 minutes if i hurry a wee bit  
jstoldt - (11:13):  but it's still a rather small wiki with few customizations  
jstoldt - (11:14): also, adding a custom skin and doing as much as possible on the documents saves a lot of time diffing through files i changed locally  
jvdrean1 joined #xwiki at 11:19  
jvdrean left at 11:21 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
silviar joined #xwiki at 11:50  
sburjan - (11:54): question : when adding a new page to a space, xwiki does verify if the page already exists or not ? (because I get OK when trying to create a page that already exists)  
camaritei joined #xwiki at 12:18  
spliffy left at 12:23 (Ping timeout: 255 seconds  
spliffy joined #xwiki at 12:23  
vmassol - (12:23): XE and XEM 2.6 released  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 12:24  
lucaa - (12:24): vmassol: any additional thoughts on the dicussion this morning about the changes to be done for XE-722 ?  
lucaa - (12:24): anybody else?  
lucaa - (12:25): I would really need your opinion on that  
lucaa - (12:25): ( jvdrean1 for example )  
vmassol - (12:25): not sure what's the question  
vmassol - (12:25): (lucaa)  
lucaa - (12:26): well the main issue would be that main dashboard (main.webhome) and the space dashboards would be different documents now  
lucaa - (12:26): actually, the main.webhome will contain directly the dashboard definition in the page, and not an include as it is now  
lucaa - (12:27): and the Main.Dashboard document will be used to display the space dashboards (listing documents and recent changes and tags for a space)  
lucaa - (12:27): normally that should be renamed as well, and even removed (since creating a dashboard for the main page of a space should be a lot easier now)  
lucaa - (12:27): wdyt about this?  
lucaa - (12:27): does it fall in the "break API" category?  
vmassol - (12:28): seems ok although I'm not sure I undertand completely  
lucaa - (12:28): the reasons behind it or what will happen?  
vmassol - (12:28): if you're not sure you can always send a mail asking for ffeedback  
lucaa - (12:28): should I send a mail where I try to explain all these changes?  
vmassol - (12:29): if you want and think there's a potential problem  
lucaa - (12:29): I do want other's opinion, but I don't know how to ask for it in a simple way  
vmassol - (12:29): make a proposal of what's going to be dsplayed in each dashboards maybe?  
lucaa - (12:29): well, a potential pb can be that users know that Main.Dashboard prints the main dashboard, or is used as a space dashboard  
lucaa - (12:30): they have built their content using this document, and now this document and its purpose will change  
lucaa - (12:30): (or even dissappear)  
lucaa - (12:30): which is why I ask what do others think  
lucaa - (12:30): the same thing will be displayed, what the users see won't change, it  
lucaa - (12:31): it's just the impl  
lucaa - (12:31): so those who customized their wiki might have surprises  
lucaa - (12:31): (for upgrades I mean)  
lucaa - (12:31): I will write a mail  
vmassol - (12:32): (otp)  
lucaa - (12:32): ok  
jstoldt - (12:36): is it just me or is deletion of a given span of versions not working?  
jstoldt - (12:37): vmassol: remember the bug regarding the missing icon in user watchlist? not working now either...  
vmassol - (12:38): jstoldt: do you have anything custom? Did you upgrade the xar pages? (would need to find out where the image is coming from)  
vmassol - (12:38): IMO it's an upgrade issue  
vmassol - (12:38): checking where it's coming from  
jstoldt - (12:39): well, not an awful lot of customization here  
jstoldt - (12:39): i copied the DefaultSkin page to another page to do some customizations to the style css  
jstoldt - (12:39): but that's really about it  
jstoldt - (12:40): spliffy: why have you changed the core.viewers.diff.editComment translation? there is no need to use html markup for Umlaute, according to the devs...  
vmassol - (12:48): still otp  
jstoldt - (12:48): ?  
vmassol - (12:50): jstoldt: src="http://localhost:8080/xwiki/resources/icons/silk/cross.gif"  
vmassol - (12:50): can you check where the broken image is pointing to?  
vmassol - (12:50): on the phone = otp  
jstoldt - (12:52): ah, that's actually the problem  
jstoldt - (12:52): i have the whole xwiki in ROOT  
jstoldt - (12:53): and thus the link created is wrong  
jstoldt - (12:53): funny, this is the first time not placing XWiki in /xwiki/ caused any trouble  
sdumitriu - (12:53): That shouldn't happen  
jstoldt - (12:53): well, what i see in the code is this:  
sdumitriu - (12:53): Can you pastebin the full HTML source?  
jstoldt - (12:54): in the source  
jstoldt - (12:54): deleteLink.insert(new Element('img', {  
spliffy - (12:54): jstoldt: i did not use html markup, what are you talking about?  
jstoldt - (12:54): 'src' : '/xwiki/resources/icons/silk/cross.gif'  
jstoldt - (12:54): }));  
arkub left at 12:55 (Quit: Leaving  
spliffy - (12:55): i changed it because the translation was wrong  
spliffy - (12:56): jstoldt: it was "kommentar ändern" before. but this is wrong because it's the label for the change comment.  
jstoldt - (12:56): spliffy: ah, okay, well, can't figure out what it used to be now but on the startpage of l10n it shows "KommentarsÄ"  
jstoldt - (12:56): yeah, might well be  
jstoldt - (12:56): i was actually wondering about what i might have written there  
jstoldt - (12:56): i figure it's the wiki that displays the html markup...  
spliffy - (12:57): probably  
jstoldt - (12:57): there is something wrong with Ä, Ö, Ü, ² and ³ in XWiki, anyway  
jstoldt - (12:57): ah, my bed, it says "&Aumlnderungskommentar:"  
jstoldt - (12:57): \*bad  
jstoldt - (12:57): well, thanks for fixing that ;)  
jstoldt - (12:58): i figure i lost sometimes ran a bit short on concentration while going through all those strings ;)  
jstoldt - (12:59): sdumitriu: the html src i posted above is sufficient for you?  
sdumitriu - (13:01): jstoldt: No  
jstoldt - (13:01): okay, will post the complete thing in a minute  
sdumitriu - (13:01): I mean, from the browser, Show Source, select all, copy/paste  
rstavro - (13:01): hi all, on VelocityCaptchaVerifier.java what value should userId have for isAnswerCorrect(String userId, String answer) ? Should it be $context.user or something like $captchaservice.getUserId($request) ?  
sdumitriu - (13:01): You can give me the link in private if there's sensitive information in there  
jstoldt - (13:01): yeah, i just pasted the excerpt above  
jstoldt - (13:02): but i'll pastebin it in a sec  
jstoldt - (13:04): this is regarding, XE-5708... just to give some more context  
jstoldt - (13:04): lol, pwned... XE-5708  
jstoldt - (13:04): oh, XWIKI-5708 i mean  
spliffy left at 13:06 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
spliffy joined #xwiki at 13:07  
vmassol left at 13:09 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 13:11  
fmancinelli left at 13:21 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 13:41  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 13:46  
rstavro left at 13:58 (Quit: Page closed  
abusenius left at 14:01 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 14:02  
vmassol - (14:07): sburjan: we'd need some doc work for xwiki.org about the new features introduced in 2.6
